debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah ODonnell
speech: Good evening and welcome the Democratic presidential primary here in South Carolina. The first primary in the South is just four days away.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: And Super Tuesday is just a week away and this is the biggest primary day of the year as voters in 14 states cast ballots and many of them tell us they have not actually made up their mind. So this debate when you think about it tonight may be the last best chance for the candidates to make their case to South Carolina and Super Tuesday voters.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah ODonnell
speech: And CBS News is proud to bring you this debate along with our co-sponsors. They are the Democratic National Committee and the Congressional Black Caucus Institute a nonpartisan organization committed to educating voters and training political leaders.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: And we are partnering tonight also with Twitter. So you at home can participate in this debate. How do you do that? Send us your questions for the candidates using the Twitter hashtag DemDebate.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah ODonnell
speech: Now here are the rules for the next two hours. When you were asked a question you will have one minute and 15 seconds to answer and 45 seconds for followups. So let begin. Senator Sanders we  had a national unemployment rate this low for this long in 50 years. Here in South Carolina the unemployment rate is even lower. How will you convince voters that a democratic socialist can do better than President Trump with the economy?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Well  right the economy is doing really great for people like Mr. Bloomberg and other billionaires. In the last three years last three years billionaires in this country saw an $850 billion increase in their wealth. But you know what for the ordinary American things are not so good. Last year real wage increases for the average worker were less than one percent. Half of our people are living paycheck to paycheck. 87 million Americans have no health insurance or are under-insured. 45 million people are struggling with student debt. 500000 people tonight are sleeping out on the street including 30000 veterans. That is not an economy  working for the American people. That an economy working for the one percent.  going to create an economy for all not just wealthy campaign contributors.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah ODonnell
speech: Mayor Bloomberg  let you respond to that. Do you think Senator Sanders' economy would be better for America than President Trump?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: I think that Donald Trump thinks it would be better if  president. I do not think so. Vladimir Putin thinks that Donald Trump should be President of the United States. And  why Russia is helping you get elected so you lose to him.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Oh Mr. Bloomberg. Let me tell Mr. Putin. Okay  not a good friend of President Xi of China. I think President Xi is an authoritarian leader. And let me tell Mr. Putin who interfered in the 2016 election try to bring Americans against Americans. Hey Mr. Putin if  President of the United States trust me  not going to interfere in anymore American elections.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Look the way I see this is that Bernie is winning right now because the Democratic Party is a progressive party and progressive ideas are popular ideas. Even if there are a lot of people on this stage who  want to say so. But Bernie and I agree on a lot of things but I think I would make a better president than Bernie. And the reason for that is that getting a progressive agenda enacted is going to be really hard and  going to take someone who digs into the details to make it happen. Bernie and I both wanted to help reign in Wall Street. In 2008 we both got our chance but I dug in I fought the big banks I built the coalitions and I won. Bernie and I both want to see universal healthcare but Bernie plan  explain how to get there  show how  going to get enough allies into it and  show enough about how  going to pay for it.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I dug in I did the work and then Bernie team trashed me for it. We need a president who is going to dig in do the hard work and actually get it done. Progressive have got one shot and we need to spend it with a leader who will get something done.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Mayor Buttigieg we want to bring you in his conversation. Why would the Russians to be working on behalf of Bernie Sanders?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: tell you what the Russians want. They  have a political party. They want chaos and chaos is what is coming our way. I mean look if you think the last four years has been chaotic divisive toxic exhausting imagine spending the better part of 2020 with Bernie Sanders versus Donald Trump. Think about what that will be like for this country. And meanwhile folks at home from South Carolina to South Bend are trying to figure out what any of this means for us. Because  right that there is a progressive majority an American majority that wants to see real change wants to see wages go up and go up faster than the cost of health and saving for retirement. But also  the majority of the American people who I think right now just to be able to turn on the TV see their President and actually feel their blood pressure go down a little bit instead of up through the roof. We have an opportunity to set a different tone.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Bernie Sanders' analysis is right. The difference is I  like his solutions. I  believe that a government takeover of large parts of the economy makes any sense for working people or for families. I think that what we need to do is to present an alternative that includes a vibrant competitive private sector but we all know unchecked capitalism has failed. The answer not for the government to take over the private sector though. The answer is for us to break the corporate stranglehold on our government and have the government work for the people again.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Well let me just finish because we need to have an alternative to Donald Trump.  talking about doubling the minimum wage cutting taxes by 10% for everybody who makes less than $250000 and creating over four and a half million good paying union jobs. Donald Trump stinks. He incompetent. As a steward of the American economy we have to show that we can create a growing prosperous economy   that works for American working people.

speech: Yes. In effect it was. Because it was about profiling people based on their race. And the mayor even said that they disproportionately stopped White people too often and minorities too little. And  not here to score points. I come at this with a great deal of humility because we have had a lot of issues especially when it comes to racial justice and policing in my own community.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: And I come to this with some humility because  conscious of the fact that there are seven White people on this stage talking about racial justice. None of us have the experience the lived experience of for example walking down the street or in a mall and feeling eyes on us regarding us as dangerous without knowing the first thing about us just because the color of our skin. None of us have the experience that Black women have had that drives that maternal mortality gap that we are all rightly horrified by of going into a doctor and being less likely to have your description of being in pain believed because of your race.

And to me that means sentencing reform like the First Step Act and extending that to the states with the Second Step Act.

debate_name: Democratic Debate Transcript: Las Vegas, Nevada Debate
speaker: Lester Holt
speech: Good evening everyone.  Lester Holt. Welcome to Las Vegas. Everything is on the line tonight with just three days before the critical Nevada caucuses. Here with me on the stage tonight NBC News Political Director and moderator of Meet the Press Chuck Todd. And NBC News Chief White House correspondent and MSNBC anchor Hallie Jackson. Also joining us is Telemundo Senior Correspondent Vanessa Hauc. And editor of the Nevada Independent Jon Ralston who has covered Nevada politics for more than three decades. The rules are this tonight candidates will get a minute 15 to answer each question and 45 seconds for followups. Now that the stage has narrowed to six candidates we encourage each of you to directly engage with each other on the issues.

debate_name: Democratic Debate Transcript: Las Vegas, Nevada Debate
speaker: Lester Holt
speech: So let get to our first question. Since the last time you all shared the stage Senator Sanders a self-described democratic socialist has surged into the lead nationally in the democratic race. And  a new person on the stage tonight Mayor Michael Bloomberg. A former Republican who spent millions of his own dollars to run in this race. What  changed? A majority of democratic voters still say their top priority is beating President Trump. Senator Sanders the first question to you Mayor Bloomberg is pitching himself as a centrist who says  best positioned to win in November. Why is your revolution a better bet?

debate_name: Democratic Debate Transcript: Las Vegas, Nevada Debate
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: In order to beat Donald Trump  going to need the largest voter turnout in the history of the United States. Mr. Bloomberg had policies in New York city of stop-and-frisk which went after African American and Latino people in an outrageous way. That is not a way  going to grow voter turnout. What our movement is about is bringing working class people together black and white and Latino Native American Asian American around an agenda that works for all of us and not just the billionaire class. And that agenda says that maybe just maybe we should join the rest of the industrialized world guarantee healthcare to all people as a human right raise that minimum wage to a living wage of 15 bucks an hour. And have the guts to take on the fossil fuel industry because their short term profits are not more important than the future of this planet and the need to combat climate change. Those are some of the reasons we have the strongest campaign to defeat Donald Trump.

debate_name: Democratic Debate Transcript: Las Vegas, Nevada Debate
speaker: Lester Holt
speech: Mayor Bloomberg can Senator Sanders beat President Trump and how do you want to respond to what else he said?

That just not a ways that you go and start building the coalition that the Sanders' camp thinks that they can do. I  think  any chance whatsoever and if he goes and is the candidate we will have Donald Trump for another four years and we  stand that.

speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: like to talk about who  running against. A billionaire who calls women fat broads and horse faced lesbians. And no  not talking about Donald Trump  talking about mayor Bloomberg. Democrats are not going to win if we have a nominee who has a history of hiding his tax returns of harassing women and of supporting racist policies like redlining and stop-and-frisk. That means building up a politics that is defined not by who we exclude not by who we reject but by how many people we can call to this side. I have seen so many people capable of forming that multiracial multi generational coalition and  seeing more and more people who maybe have not felt welcome in the Democratic party before but belong here now because  definitely not on board with  going on in the Trump white house. I am asking you to join me to vote for me to caucus for me and to help us build that future defined not by exclusion but by belonging.

debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Did you call my name? This is a dark moment in America and yet I come here tonight with a heart filled with hope. All three of my brothers served in the military.  all retired.  all back in Oklahoma. One is a Democrat two are Republicans. But you know what unites my three brothers Amazon they are furious that Amazon reported $10 billion in profits and paid zero in taxes. My brothers are part of why is ready to root out corruption and fight back and that gives us a base to work from. America is ready for 2 cent wealth tax. It supported by Republicans Democrats and Independents and it lets us invest in all of our children.

debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: America is ready to expand social security payments and disability payments by $200 a month and we can do it. You know someone asks what this would mean you just give somebody $200 a month. debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: 45 years Americans have been listening to great speeches and at the end of the day the average American worker is not making a nickel more than he or she did in real wages over those 45 years. The truth is that real change always takes place. Real change always takes place from the bottom on up never from the top on down. And that is why in this campaign I am so proud that we have over a million volunteers. We have some of the strongest grassroots organizations. We have raised more individual contributions than any candidate in American history. Please join the political revolution @berniesanders.com. Let defeat Trump. Let transform this country. Thank you.

debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles
speaker: Joe Biden

Number two who can help elect Democrats to the United States Senate in States like North Carolina and Georgia and Arizona and other States.

debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles
speaker: Joe Biden

And so I think asking those questions I believe as you expect that  the most qualified to answer those three questions. But most of all  got to level with the American people.  play games with them tell them the truth and be authentic. God bless you all and may you all have a great great holiday season and thank you guys for doing this as well.

debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles

debate_name: December Democratic Debate Transcript: Sixth Debate from Los Angeles

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta

Ambassador Gordon Sondland delivered testimony today in the House impeachment inquiry that buttressed the case that President Trump withheld military aid to Ukraine and a White House meeting with President Zelensky because he wanted the Ukrainian president to announce investigations that would benefit President Trump politically. Senator Warren you have said already that  seen enough to convict the president and remove him from office. You and four of your colleagues on this stage tonight who are also US Senators may soon have to take that vote. Will you try to convince your Republican colleagues in the Senate to vote the same way? And if so how?

speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Of course I will. And the obvious answer is to say first read the Mueller Report all 442 pages of it that showed how the president tried to obstruct justice and when Congress failed to act at that moment and that the president felt free to break the law again and again and again. And   happened with Ukraine. We have to establish the principle no one is above the law. We have a constitutional responsibility and we need to meet it. But I want to add one more part based on today testimony and that is how did Ambassador Sondland get there? This is not a man who had any qualifications except one. He wrote a check a million dollars and that tells us about  happening in Washington.

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: The corruption how money buys its way into Washington. You know I raised this months ago about the whole notion that donors think  going to get ambassadorships on the other side. And  taken a pledge. Anyone who wants to give me a big donation  ask to be an ambassador because  not going to have that happen. I asked everyone who running for president to join me in that and not a single person has so far. I hope what we saw today during the testimony means lots of people will sign on and say we are not going to give away these ambassador posts to the highest bidder.

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta
speaker: Rachel Maddow
speech: Senator Warren thank you Senator Klobuchar  said that you support the impeachment inquiry but you want to wait for a Senate trial to hear the evidence and make a decision about convicting the president. After the bombshell testimony of Ambassador Sondland today has that view changed for you?

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: I have made it very clear that this is impeachable conduct and  called for an impeachment proceeding. I just believe our job as jurors is to look at each count and make a decision. But let me make very clear that what this impeachment proceeding about is really our democracy at stake. This is a president that not only with regard to his conduct with Ukraine but every step of the way puts his own private interests his own partisan interests his own political interests in front of our country interest. And this is wrong. This is a pattern with this man and it goes to everything from how he has betrayed our farmers and our workers to what he has done with foreign affairs leaving the Kurds for slaughter sucking up to Vladimir Putin every minute of the day.

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: That is what this guy does. And I think it is very very important that we have a president  going to put our country first. I was thinking about this when I was at the Carter Presidential Museum and on the wall are etched the words of Walter Mondale when he looked back at their four years not perfect and he said this We told the truth. We obey the law. We kept the peace. We told the truth we obeyed the law. We kept the peace. That is the minimum that we should expect in a President of the United States.

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta

speech: Senator thank you Senator Sanders  like to go to you. Americans are watching these impeachment hearings. At the same time  also focused on their more immediate daily economic and family concerns. We are facing the great existential crisis about time in terms of climate change. debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta

If you want to be part of a movement that is not only going to beat Trump but transform America that  have a super PAC  do fundraisers at wealthy people home please join us at berniesanders.com. Thank you.

debate_name: November Democratic Debate Transcript  5th Debate Transcript from Atlanta

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Anderson Cooper
speech: It the CNN New York Times Democratic presidential debate. We want to welcome our viewers in the United States and watching around the world watching us on CNN CNN International CNN Espanol cnn.com thenewyorktimes.com CNN CNN Facebook page and listening on the Westworld One Radio Network Sirius XM satellite radio NPR and the American Forces Network.  Anderson Cooper moderating tonight debate along with CNN Erin Burnett and New York Times national editor Marc Lacey. We are in Ohio tonight because  one of the most critical battleground states. Ohio has backed all but two presidential winners in every election since 1896.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Erin Burnett
speech: The top 12 democratic presidential candidates are at their positions behind the podiums. This is a record number of candidates for a presidential primary debate. So to accommodate the large group there are no opening statements tonight.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Marc Lacey
speech: Before we begin a reminder of the ground rules  each receive 75 seconds to answer questions 45 seconds for responses and rebuttals and 15 seconds for clarifications. Please refrain from interrupting your fellow candidates as that will count against your time.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Anderson Cooper
speech: And we remind our audience here in the Rike Center at Otterbein to be respectful so the candidates can hear the questions and each other. All right let begin. Since the last debate House Democrats have officially launched an impeachment inquiry against President Trump which all the candidates on this stage support. Senator Warren I want to start with you. You have said that  already enough evidence for President Trump to be impeached and removed from office. But the question is with the election only one year away why  it be the voters who determine the president fate?

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Because sometimes there are issues that are bigger than politics. And I think  the case with this impeachment inquiry. When I made the decision to run for president I certainly  think it was going to be about impeachment but when the Mueller report came out I read it all 442 pages. And when I got to the end I realized that Mueller had shown to a fare thee well that this president had obstructed justice and done it repeatedly. And so at that moment I called for opening an impeachment inquiry. Now that  happen and look what happened as a result Donald Trump broke the law again in the summer broke it again this fall. You know we took a constitutional oath and that is that no one is above the law and that includes the President of the United States. Impeachment is the way that we establish that this man will not be permitted to break the law over and over without consequences. This is about Donald Trump but understand  about the next president and the next president and the next president and the future of this country. The impeachment must go forward.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Anderson Cooper
speech: Thank you Senator Warren.  all going to get in on this by the way. Senator Sanders do Democrats have any choice but to impeach President Trump? Please respond.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: No they . In my judgment Trump is the most corrupt president in the history of this country. It not just that he obstructed justice with the Mueller report. I think that the House will find him guilty of worthy of impeachment because of the emoluments clause. This is a president who is enriching himself while using the Oval Office to do that and that is outrageous. And I think in terms of the recent Ukrainian incident the idea that we have a President of the United States who is prepared to hold back national security money to one of our allies in order to get dirt on a presidential candidate is beyond comprehension. So I look forward by the way not only to a speedy and expeditious impeachment process but Mitch McConnell has got to do the right thing and allow a free and fair trial in the Senate.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Anderson Cooper
speech: Vice President Biden during the Clinton impeachment proceedings you said and I quote The American people  think that  made a mistake by electing Bill Clinton and we in Congress had better be very careful before we upset their decision. debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

speech: Yes they have. I said from the beginning that if in fact Trump continued to stonewall what the Congress is entitled to know about his background what he did all the accusations in the Mueller report. This president and I agree with Bernie Senator Sanders is the most corrupt president in modern history and I think all of our history. And the fact is that this President of United States has gone so far as to say since this latest event that in fact he will not cooperate in any way at all will not list any witnesses will not provide information will not do anything to cooperate with the impeachment. They have no choice but to move.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Maya Angelou who told us years ago listen to somebody when they tell you who they are the first time. During that election Donald Trump told us he could shoot somebody on Fifth Avenue and get away with it. And he has consistently since he won been selling out the American people. He been selling out working people. He been selling out our values  been selling out national security and on this issue with Ukraine  been selling out our democracy. Our framers imagined this moment a moment where we would have a corrupt president. And our framers then rightly designed our system of democracy to say there will be checks and balances. This is one of those moments. And so Congress must ask but the reality of it is that I  really think this impeachment process is going to take very long because as a former prosecutor I know a confession when I see it.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris

This will not take very long. Donald Trump needs to be held accountable. He is indeed the most corrupt and unpatriotic president we have ever had.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Anybody who has criticisms about a process that is making all the facts bare before the American public that works to build consensus. That what this nation needs in what is a moral moment and not a political one. So I swore an oath to do my job as a Senator do my duty. This president has violated his I will do mine.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

It also about the presidency itself because a president 10 years or 100 years from now will look back at this moment and draw the conclusion either that no one is above the law or that a president can get away with anything. But everyone on this stage by definition is competing to be a president for after the Trump presidency. Remember one way or the other this presidency is going to come to an end. I want you to picture what  going to be like what  actually going to feel like in this country the first day the sun comes up after Donald Trump has been president.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: It starts out feeling like a happy thought. debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Anderson Cooper

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Tulsi Gabbard

And as unhappy as that may make us as Democrats he won that election in 2016. The serious issues that have been raised around this phone call that he had with the president of Ukraine and many other things that transpired around that are what caused me to support the inquiry in the House and I think that it should continue to play its course out together. All the information provide that to the American people recognizing that that is the only way forward. If the House votes to impeach the Senate does not vote to remove Donald Trump he walks out and he feels exonerated further deepening the divides in this country that we cannot afford.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Beto ORourke

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

speech: We want to move now now to the economy Senator Warren    proposed some sweeping plans free public college    Thank you.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren

But then they found out when they really needed it when the costs went up that the insurance company pulled the rug out from underneath them and they were left with nothing.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Look the way I see this it is hard enough to get a diagnosis that your child has cancer. I will not sign a bill into law that does not lower costs for middle class families.

speaker: Marc Lacey
speech: Mayor Buttigieg you say Senator Warren has been evasive about how s going to pay for Medicare for All. What your response?

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Well we heard it tonight. A yes or no question that  get a yes or no answer. This is why people here in the Midwest are so frustrated with Washington in general and Capitol Hill in particular. And the thing is we really can deliver healthcare for every American and move forward with the boldest biggest transformation since the inception of Medicare itself. But the way to do it without a giant multi-trillion dollar hole and without having to avoid a yes or no question is Medicare for All who want it. We take a version of Medicare we let you access it if you want to. And if you prefer to stay on your private plan you can do that too. That is what most Americans want. Medicare for all who want it trusting you to make the right decision for your healthcare and for your family. And it can be delivered without

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: So let be clear whenever someone hears the term Medicare for All who want it understand what that really means. It Medicare for All who can afford it and  the problem  got. Medicare for All is the gold standard. It is the way we get healthcare coverage for every single American including the family whose child been diagnosed with cancer including the person who just gotten an M.S. diagnosis. They will not go up for middle class families and I will not sign a bill into law that raises their costs because costs are what people care about.  been studying this for the biggest part of my life why people go bankrupt.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: I  think the American people are wrong when they say that what they want is a choice and the choice of Medicare for All who want it which is affordable for everyone because we make sure that the subsidies are in place allows you to get that healthcare. And I  understand why you believe the only way to deliver affordable coverage to everybody is to obliterate private plans kicking 150 million Americans off of their insurance in four short years when we could achieve that same big bold goal. And once again  competing to be president for the day after Trump. Our country will be horrifyingly polarized even more than now. debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: As somebody who wrote the damn bill as I said. Let be clear on the Medicare for All bill that I wrote premiums are gone co-payments are gone deductibles are gone. All out of pocket expenses are gone.  going to do better than the Canadian doing that is what they have managed to do. At the end of the day the overwhelming majority of people will save money on their healthcare bills. But I do think it is appropriate to acknowledge that taxes will go up.  going to go up significantly for the wealthy and for virtually everybody the tax increase they pay will be substantially less substantially less than what they were paying for premiums and out of pocket expenses.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Marc Lacey
speech: Senator Warren will you acknowledge what the Senator just said about taxes going up?

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: At least Bernie being honest here and saying how  going to pay for this and that taxes are going to go up and  sorry Elizabeth but you have not said that and I think we owe it to the American people to tell them where  going to send the invoice. I believe the best and boldest idea here is to not trash Obamacare but to do exactly what Barack Obama wanted to do from the beginning and  have a public option that would bring down the cost of the premium and expand the number of people covered and take on the pharmaceutical companies. That is what we should be doing instead of kicking 149 million people off their insurance in four years. And  tired of hearing whenever I say these things Oh  Republican talking points. You are making Republican talking points right now in this room by coming out for a plan  going to do that. I think there is a better way that is bold that will cover more people and  the one we should get behind.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Yeah I  spend most of my time in Washington. I spent most of my time studying one basic question and that is why hardworking people go broke. debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Breaking up the tech companies does nothing to make our kids healthier. What we have to do is we have to home in on the specific problems  trying to solve and use 21st century solutions for 21st century problems. Using a 20th century antitrust framework will not work. speech: Look  not willing to give up and let a handful of monopolists dominate our economy and our democracy. It time to fight back. Think about it this way. When you talk about how it works in competition about 8% 9% of all retail sales happen in bricks and sticks stores happen at Walmart. About 49% of all sales online happen in one place. That Amazon. It collects information from every little business and then Amazon does something else. It runs the platform gets all the information and then goes into competition with those little businesses. Look you get to be the umpire in the baseball game or you get to have a team but you  get to do both at the same time. We need to enforce our antitrust laws break up these giant companies that are dominating big tech big pharma big oil all of them.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Tom Steyer

I started a business from scratch one room no employers and built a multi-billion dollar international business.  going to have to show the American people that we  just know how to tax and have programs to break up companies but also talk about prosperity talk about investing in the American people talk about harnessing the innovation and competition of the American private sector.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

We have a reality in this country where antitrust from pharma to farms is causing trouble. We have to deal with this. As president of the United States I will put people in place that enforce antitrust laws.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Cory Booker

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

speech: Yeah. We need to set very tough very clear transparent rules of the road. The kind of rules that we do not have today. That allow these social media platforms where we the people have become the product to abuse that public trust. To do so at extraordinary profits. Right now we treat them functionally as a utility. When in reality  more akin to a publisher. They curate the content that we see. Our pictures and personal information that they share with others. We would allow no publisher to do what Facebook is doing. To publish that ad that Senator Warren has rightfully called out that CNN has refused to air because it is untrue and tells lies about the Vice President. Treat them like the publisher that they are. That what I will do as president.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Beto ORourke
speech: We will be unafraid to breakup big businesses if we have to do that. But I  think it is the role of a president or a candidate for the presidency to specifically call out which companies will be broken up. That something that Donald Trump has done. In part because he sees enemies in the press and wants to diminish their power. It not something that we should do.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Beto ORourke
speech: Tough rules of the road protect your personal information privacy and data. Be fearless in the face of these tech giants.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

speech: When we talk about a rigged economy  not just the grotesque level of income in wealth and equality. It is also the fact that in sector after sector whether it is Wall Street where you have six banks that have assets equivalent to half of the GDP of the United States; whether it is media where you have 10 media companies that control about 90% of what the American people see hear or read; whether it is agribusiness where we see merger after merger which is resulting in the decline of family based farming in this country we need a president who has the guts to appoint an Attorney General who will take on these huge monopolies protect small business and protect consumers by ending the price fixing which we see every day.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Marc Lacey

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris
speech: No I  agree with that at all. As serving on the Senate Intelligence Committee working with Amy Klobuchar on what we need to do to upgrade the elections infrastructure knowing that Russia needs to be held accountable for the fact that they interfered in the election of the president of the United States and will attempt to do it again  a ridiculous argument  making.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris
speech: But I do want to also say this. What  talking about is a grave injustice. When rules apply to some but not equally to all. In particular when the rules that apply to the powerless  apply to the powerful.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris
speech: Senator Warren I just want to say that I was surprised to here that you did not agree with me that on this subject of what should be the rules around corporate responsibility for these big tech companies. When I called on Twitter to suspend Donald Trump account that you did not agree. I would urge you to join me because here we have Donald Trump who has 65 million Twitter followers and is using that platform as the president of the United States to openly intimidate witnesses to threaten witnesses to obstruct justice. He and his account should be taken down.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris
speech: We saw in El Paso that that shooter in his manifesto was informed by how Donald Trump uses that platform. This is a matter of corporate responsibility. Twitter should be held accountable and shutdown that site. It is a matter of safety and corporate accountability.

speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Look I  just want to push Donald Trump off Twitter. I want to push him out of The White House. That our job. But the way-

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris
speech: Join me in saying that his Twitter account should be shut down.

speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: for antitrust for over a century. Yet for decades now  all called on how the big drug companies are calling the shots in Washington Big Ag how the gun industry big tech. We really need to address the elephant in the room and that is how campaigns are financed.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

We are seeing a startup slump in this country-

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Wade our Department of Justice will review that law to determine if it is compliant with Roe v. Wade and the Constitution. If it is not that law will not go into affect. That called pre-clearance.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Kamala Harris

The reality of it is this is still a fundamental issue of justice for women in America. Women have been given the responsibility to perpetuate the human species. Our bodies were created to do that. It does not give any other person the right to tell a woman what to do with that body. It is her body it is her right it is her decision.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Then you tried to dial it back and you said you wanted to put doctors in jail. That is exactly what the Alabama law is. It put doctors in jail for 99 years. You Donald Trump are not on the side of women. You are not on the side of people of this country when over 75% of people want to keep Roe v. Wade on the book. When over 90% of people want to make sure we have available contraception. You defunded Planned Parenthood. I would fund it again.

Because this is disproportionately affecting low income women in this country people in rural areas in this country. It is an assault on the most fundamental ideal that human beings should control their own body.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Wade. I will fight to codify it. I will also make sure that we fight as this country to repeal the Hyde Amendment so that we are leading the planet Earth in defending the global-

We see how the consequences of laws that  referring to can often lead to a dangerous place. As  seen them as  passed in other countries where a woman who has a miscarriage passed that six weeks could be imprisoned because abortion would be illegal at that point.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Wade is overturned on your watch and you  pass legislation in Congress would you seek to add justices to the Supreme Court to protect women reproductive rights?

I would go out and I would campaign against those people in the state of Ohio Alabama et cetera who in fact are throwing up this barrier. Reproductive rights are a constitutional right. In fact every woman should have that right. I would not pack the Court. What I would do is make sure that the people that I recommended for the Court from Ruth Bader Ginsburg to Elena Kagan who used to work for me to others that they in fact support the right of privacy. On which the entire notion of a woman right to choose is based. That what I would do. No one would get on the Court

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Joe Biden

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Now  not talking about packing the Court just with people who agree with me although I certainly will appoint people who share my values. For example the idea that women reproductive freedom is an American right. What  talking about is reforms that will depoliticize the Court. We  go on like this where every single time there is a vacancy we have this apocalyptic ideological firefight over what to do next.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Now one way to fix this would be to have a 15 member Court where five of the members can only be appointed by unanimous agreement of the other 10. Smarter legal minds than mine are discussing this in the Yale Law Journal on how this could be done without a constitutional amendment. But the point is that not everybody arrives on a partisan basis. There are other reforms that we could consider. From term limits  forget justices used to just retire like everybody else to a rotation off the appellate bench.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: not wedded to a particular solution but I am committed to establishing a commission on day one-

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Pete Buttigieg

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

Rich women still got abortions because they could travel they could go to places where it was legal. What  talking about now is that the people who are denied access to abortion are the poor are the young are 14 year olds who were molested by a family member. We now have support across this country. Three out of four Americans believe in the rule of Roe versus Wade. When  got three out of four Americans supporting it we should be able to get that passed through Congress.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: We should not leave this to the Supreme Court we should do it through democracy because we can.

speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Well I think there vision is attracting a lot of people. I think a lot of what they have to say is really important. But as Senator Warren said We  be running any vague campaigns. speaker: Bernie Sanders

It going to take away the right of people to choose. The 160 million people out there  negotiated their health insurance and they want to keep it. They should have a right to keep it.

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio
speaker: Elizabeth Warren

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

debate_name: October Democratic Debate Transcript: 4th Debate in Ohio

It was about 20 years ago that I came out of my home when I moved to inner city New Jersey and witnessed the aftermath of a shooting. It one of the reasons why shooting after shooting in neighborhoods like mine for decades this has been a crisis for me. It why I was the first person to come out for gun licensing. And  happy that people like Beto  are showing such courage now and coming forward and also now supporting licensing but this is what  sorry about.  sorry that it had to take issues coming to my neighborhood or personally affecting Beto to suddenly make us demand change. This is a crisis of empathy in our nation.

debate_name: September Houston Democratic Debate Transcript  Third Debate
debate_section: Part 1: Gun Control, Healthcare, Criminal Justice
speaker: Cory Booker
speech: We are never going to solve this crisis if we have to wait for it to personally affect us or our neighborhood our community before we demand action. You want to know how we get this done? They stand up and understand the truth of what King said that injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. I will lead change on this issue because I have seen what the carnage creates in communities like mine. Because we forget national shootings these mass shootings or tragedies but the majority of the homicide victims come from neighborhoods like mine. Nobody has ascended to the White House that will bring more personal passion on this issue. I will fight this and bring a fight to the NRA and the corporate gun lobby like they have never seen before.

debate_name: September Houston Democratic Debate Transcript  Third Debate

debate_name: September Houston Democratic Debate Transcript  Third Debate
debate_section: Part 2: National Security, International Relations, Education

speaker: Speaker 12
speech: All right. Let take a look at the electoral college and 2020. The place to start obviously is where the last election ended 2016. And remember of course by the popular vote Hillary Clinton had almost 3 million more of those than Donald Trump but we  elect the president by national popular vote. We do it by the electoral college and there Donald Trump had the right combination of votes in the right states enough to win 306 electoral votes for him.

debate_name: Transcript from Night 1 of the 2019 June Democratic Debates
speaker: Speaker 12
speech: o how is that map looking for 2020? Well first of all I think one thing you need to do just understand how narrow that Trump path was in the electoral college in 2016. You can start by looking at Wisconsin. Look at that margin there. Fewer than 25000 votes separated Clinton from Trump in Wisconsin. This was a state that had not gone for a Republican in a presidential election since 1984 by a margin of fewer than 25000 votes Trump becomes the first in over three decades. He gets Wisconsin. debate_name: Transcript from Night 1 of the 2019 June Democratic Debates
speaker: Beto ORourke
speech: John I appreciate the question. The answer is yes but that action should always be undertaken with allies and partners and friends. When the United States presents a united front we have a much better chance of achieving our foreign policy aims and preventing the kind of genocide to which you refer the kind of genocide that we saw in Rwanda the kind of genocide we want to stop going forward. But unfortunately under this administration President Trump has alienated our allies and our friends and our alliances. He diminished our standing in the world and  made us weaker as a country. Less able to confront challenges whether  Iran or North Korea or Vladimir Putin in Russia who attacked and invaded our democracy in 2016 and who President Trump has offered another invitation to do the same. He embraced strong men and dictators at the expense of the great democracies. As president I will make sure that we live our values in our foreign policy. I will ensure that we strengthen those alliances and partnerships and friendships and meet any challenge that we face together. That makes America stronger.

My dad served in the Pacific in World War II in the US Army Battle of Okinawa had half his leg blown off and he came home with scars both physical and emotional and he did not recover. He spiraled downward and he ultimately took his own life. And that battle  kill him but that war did. And look even in the humanitarian crisis And I think we should be ready Congressman to intervene god forbid there is a genocide but not without congressional approval. Democrats and Republicans both in the Congress have not challenged presidents and have let them get away with running the military without that congressional approval. We learned a lesson in Vietnam we seem to have forgotten. The decisions have to be made by the United States Congress in the name of the people.
